newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan mayor in hot water after viewing women's spa.
newsitem.headline: Japan mayor in hot water after viewing women's spa.

text.p: The mayor of a northern Japanese city apologised after he made some 20 female bathers steaming mad when he peeked into the ladies' dressing room of a hot springs health spa during a tour of the city-run facility.

Yoichiro Iino, mayor of Kitakata in mountainous Fukushima prefecture, 240 km (140 miles) northeast on Tokyo, said he had "no ulterior motives" when he peeked into the ladies' dressing room of the newly-opened spa, run by his city.
"I was worried about how turnout would be after the (April 15-17) free entry promotion ended," the 72-year-old mayor said, adding he was sorry for being careless.
Iino was berated by several naked middle-aged women when he examined their dressing room on April 18 during an official inspection of the spa, witnesses said.
